responses.rationale: Describes a measure ('mandated culling') and its effect ('virus is primarily an animal health issue') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a safeguard ('recommends cooking poultry') and its purpose ('reduce the potential') factually without active reassurance.
The segment is a question, not a statement of capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a potential negative future outcome ('some shortages'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('Prices... were also rising'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a potential negative future outcome ('prices could also become more volatile'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a capability/measure ('Testing... involves swabbing') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a capability/measure ('samples are sent... to be analyzed') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a negative fact ('Outbreaks have been detected'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('had been detected in 19 states'), not primarily a capability or preparedness statement.
Describes a negative fact ('totaled more than 17 million'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a measure/safeguard ('required to be euthanized') and its purpose ('to prevent the spread') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a negative fact ('constituted the largest infected flock'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('was next on the list'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('was the third-largest infected flock'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
The segment is a question, not a statement of capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('Nearly 50 million birds died'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative fact ('has raised concerns'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes negative facts ('Symptoms... include'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes negative facts ('is closely related to an Asian strain'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a negative consequence ('have halted imports'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a hopeful future possibility ('restrictions... may be short-lived') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a negative fact ('seeing more geographic spread'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
The segment is a question, not a statement of capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes past emphasis on preparedness/safeguards ('emphasized a hardening of 'biosecurity' measures') factually without active reassurance.
Describes safeguards ('Biosecurity measures include') factually without active reassurance.
Describes a factor contributing to spread ('can contribute to spreading'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a factor contributing to spread ('So can farm workers having contact'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
Describes a necessity for improved safeguards/preparedness ('has to be considering how to improve their biosecurity') factually without active reassurance.
Describes negative facts ('Infected birds can experience'), not a capability, preparedness, safeguard, or hopeful possibility.
